metadata.title: CVE-2022-40188 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Knot Resolver before 5.5.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (CPU consumption) because of algorithmic complexity. During anattack, an authoritative server must return large NS sets or address sets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot-resolver - 3.2.1-3ubuntu2.1
knot-resolver-module-http - 3.2.1-3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot-resolver package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.1-3ubuntu2.1').
